name: Hobo Bread
author: STELLASMOM
summary: Two kinds of raisins beautify this humble quick bread. This is an unusual bread baked in 3 coffee cans. It must be started the night before.
directions: Place the dark and golden raisins in a medium bowl
Dissolve baking soda in boiling water, and pour over raisins
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Grease three 1 pound sized coffee cans
In a large bowl, stir together the flour, sugar and salt
Stir in the raisins with their water, and the oil until well blended
Divide the batter evenly between the 3 cans
Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the crown comes out clean
Lay cans on their side to loosen the bread as it cools
